article_title: Internships aren't just for summer anymore
article_text:
Internships aren't just for summer anymore

Photo: Andrew D. Brosig, Associated Press Karina Munoz (left) a business management major from Houston,...

When I graduated from college, back when "Charlie's Angels" was still a popular television show, most of my friends either found a job or went to graduate school. And the job was typically full-time, regular employment.

article_metadata.description: When I graduated from college, back when "Charlie's Angels" was still a popular television show, most of my friends either found a job or went to graduate school.  The trend toward short-term assignments has been around for a while but it seems to be picking up steam, said Jamie Belinne, assistant dean for career services at the C.T. Bauer College of Business at the University of Houston.  Post-college internships are typically paid positions, unlike some of the internships that provide college credit instead of wages, and they appeal to many new graduates, including Challenger's daughter.  Under the rules of the Affordable Care Act, adult children can stay on their parent's health insurance policies until they turn 26.
article_metadata.author.name: By L.M. Sixel
